Detailed Description

Color handling.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum cvl_color_t

The representation of colors. These color values correspond to the SVG color names defined by the W3c in the SVG 1.1 specification. See <http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/types.html>.

Enumerator:

Function Documentation

cvl_color_t cvl_color_from_string ( const char *  s  ) 

Parameters:
s The string.
Returns:
color The color.
Converts a color string into a color value. Valid strings are SVG color names as defined in the W3C standard SVG 1.1 (see <http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/types.html>), RGB values in the form 0xrrggbb, and decimal values prepended with r, g, or b, for example r127g64b12. If s is not a valid color string, the special value CVL_COLOR_INVALID is returned.

void cvl_color_to_float ( cvl_color_t  c,
cvl_format_t  format,
float *  result 
)

Parameters:
c The color.
format The format.
result The result.
Converts the CVL color c to four floating point values using the color format format-

void cvl_gl_set_color ( cvl_color_t  c,
cvl_format_t  format 
)

Parameters:
c The color.
format The format.
Sets the OpenGL color to the given CVL color c. Set the format parameter to the format of the frame you want to use the color with.

void cvl_channel_combine ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  c0,
cvl_frame_t *  c1,
cvl_frame_t *  c2,
cvl_frame_t *  c3 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
c0 The first channel.
c1 The second channel.
c2 The third channel.
c3 The fourth channel.
Combines the channels c0, c1, c2, and c3 into the frame dst. Channels that are NULL will not be set to zero in the result. At least one channel must be given. The number of channels in the resulting frame must match.

void cvl_channel_extract ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
int  channel 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
channel The channel number.
Extracts the given channel channel (0, 1, 2, or 3) from the frame src into the frame dst at channel 0.

void cvl_convert_format ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
Converts the format of frame src into the format of frame dst while transferring the contents of src to dst.

void cvl_convert_format_inplace ( cvl_frame_t *  frame,
cvl_format_t  format 
)

Parameters:
frame The frame.
format The format.
Converts the format of frame frame to format.

void cvl_invert ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
Inverts the frame src into dst.
The format of the frames must be CVL_LUM or CVL_RGB.

void cvl_gamma_correct ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
float  gamma 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
gamma The gamma value.
Applies gamma correction to the frame src and writes the result to dst. The function does the right thing for known color formats. For unknown formats, it applies gamma correction to all channels.

void cvl_color_adjust ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
float  hue,
float  saturation,
float  lightness,
float  contrast 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
hue Additive constant for the hue value.
saturation Modification of saturation.
lightness Modification of lightness.
contrast Modification of contrast.
Manipulates the colors of the frame src in the CVL_HSL color space, and writes the result to dst.
The parameter hue is an angle from [-PI,PI] that will be added to the hue angle. The new saturation, lightness, and contrast values of the frame will each be computed with the following formula: new_x = old_x + factor * old_x, where factor is the corresponding parameter. Thus, a parameter saturation = -1 will set the color saturation to zero for the frame, which results in a gray level frame.
The format of the input frame must be CVL_HSL.

void cvl_transform_linear ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
int  channel,
float  min,
float  max 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
channel The channel.
min The minimum value.
max The maximum value.
Does a linear transform of the interval [min, max] to [0,1] on the given channel (0-3) of the frame src and write the result to dst. If channel is -1, the transformation will be done for all channels. Values outside of the given interval will be clipped.

void cvl_transform_log ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
int  channel,
float  min,
float  max,
float  base 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
channel The channel.
min The minimum value.
max The maximum value.
base The base of the logarithm.
Does a logarithmic transform of the interval [min, max] to [0,1] on the given channel (0-3) of the frame src and writes the result to dst. If channel is -1, the transformation will be done for all channels. Values outside of the given interval will be clipped.

void cvl_luminance_range ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
float  lum_min,
float  lum_max 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
lum_min The minimum value.
lum_max The maximum value.
Selects the luminance range from lum_min to lum_max from the input frame src, transforms the result to (0,1] and writes it to the frame dst. This function needs CVL_XYZ frames for input and output. The color information will be preserved.

void cvl_pseudo_color ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
int  channel,
bool  cyclic,
float  startcolor,
float  lightness,
float  min,
float  max 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
channel The channel.
cyclic Use cyclic pseudo colors?
startcolor The color to map to the minimum value.
lightness The usage of lightness variability.
min The minimum value.
max The maximum value.
Transforms the values in channel channel (0-3) of the frame src to pseudo colors and writes the result to dst. The startcolor parameter sets the color that is mapped to the minimum value. It must be from [0,1] and is usually 0 for blue. The parameter lightness specifies the amount of lightness variability in the pseudo color frame. It must be from [0,1] and is usually 0. The channel values are expected to be in the range from min to max. The dst frame must be in CVL_HSL format.

void cvl_threshold ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
int  channel,
float  threshold 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
channel The channel(s).
threshold The threshold.
Sets all pixels in the given channel (0-3 or -1 for all channels) of the frame src to either 1.0 (if its value was >= threshold) or 0.0 (if its value was < threshold). The result is written to dst.
